page.title: 05Hop Farming In Horsmonden
page.content: The traditional occupation of the area is farming particularly fruit and hops. A hop garden has a wire framework erected over it and in the Spring strings have to be set from the frame to the ground for the hops to climb. Later on the hop shoots are trained up the strings. In September the hops are ready to pick. In days gone by families of hop-pickers came from the East End of London to pick the hops. They picked by pulling down the hop bines and putting the hops into bins, which were made of sacking on a wooden frame. The hops were measured in bushels from the bins and put into sacks called pokes to be taken to the oast house to be dried. Nowadays the hops are picked from the bines by machine.
